parts.stem: A factory determines that the cost, in dollars, of the factory’s monthly operation of making \displaystyle{x} smartphones is given by \displaystyle{100{,}000+100x-0.01x^2}, where \displaystyle{0\leq x \leq 4{,}000}. The rate of change in the average cost per smartphone when the factory manufactures 100 smartphones = \displaystyle{\$\textBlank /{\textrm{smartphone}}^2}. Round your answer to the nearest dollar.

A team determines that if the factory manufactures \displaystyle{x} smartphones per month, the recommended retail price per smartphone, in dollars, is \displaystyle{600-0.1x}, where \displaystyle{0\leq x \leq 4{,}000}.

Assuming that all manufactured smartphones are sold at the recommended price, the rate of change in the monthly profit when 100 smartphones are manufactured = \displaystyle{\$\textBlank /\textrm{smartphone}}. Round your answer to the nearest dollar.

metadata.description: A factory determines that the cost, in dollars, of the factory’s monthly operation of making x smartphones is given by 100,000+100x-0.01x^2, where 0≤ x ≤ 4,000. The rate of change in the average cost per smartphone when the factory manufactures 100 smartphones = _/smartphone^2. Round your answer to the nearest dollar. A team determines that if the factory manufactures x smartphones per month, the recommended retail price per smartphone, in dollars, is 600-0.1x, where 0≤ x ≤ 4,000.Assuming that all manufactured smartphones are sold at the recommended price, the rate of change in the monthly profit when 100 smartphones are manufactured = _/smartphone. Round your answer to the nearest dollar.
